conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a cutaway/isometric-style 3D model with extruded walls (height + thickness), visible floor plane, multi-face wall surfaces, and the ceiling/roof removed to expose the interior.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear 3D extrusion with readable corners and interior volume; angled view is appropriate and cutaway is clean. Minor simplification in some wall terminations/edges.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room zoning matches (kitchen left/top-left, dining top-right, living right, stairs left/bottom-left, bathroom central). Some openings (doors/windows) and a few wall lengths/partition offsets appear approximated rather than exact to the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture/elements present: kitchen counters/appliances, dining table/chairs, living seating, bathroom fixtures, stair geometry. Placement generally corresponds to the correct rooms; minor scale/orientation simplifications.

visual_clarity.notes: Walls/floors/openings are distinguishable and the interior is visible. Lighting is adequate. Minor readability issues from similar wall/floor tones and some simplified geometry; no major artifacts.

detected_errors.description: Some door/window placements and/or counts appear not perfectly aligned with the 2D plan (openings look approximated in the 3D model).
Minor-to-moderate proportional drift in a few wall/partition lengths compared to the 2D plan (overall layout correct but not dimension-faithful everywhere).

summary: A true cutaway 3D conversion with correct overall room arrangement and furnishings, but with some proportional and opening-placement inaccuracies versus the 2D plan.
